ide.title: IDE Integration
ide.note: Note: Paths with spaces must be wrapped in quotes.

terminal.title: Terminal
terminal.note: Note: Paths with spaces must be wrapped in quotes.

presets.windowsTerminalDesc: Uses matching profile if exists, otherwise default
presets.windowsTerminalPreviewDesc: Uses matching profile if exists, otherwise default

window.title: Window Behavior
window.description: Configure what happens when you close the window
window.askDesc: Show a dialog to choose between minimizing to tray or quitting
window.minimizeDesc: Hide the window to the system tray instead of closing
window.quitDesc: Close the application completely when clicking the X button

language.title: Language
language.description: Choose the display language for the application

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.debugLoggingDesc: Enable verbose logs for troubleshooting. Logs more detail to help diagnose issues.

theme.title: Color Theme
theme.tip: Tip: Changes are applied immediately and saved automatically.

builtIn.monokai: Classic editor theme with vibrant colors
builtIn.forest-mist: Earthy sage with warm amber highlights
builtIn.rose-quartz: Soft mauve with dusty rose accents
builtIn.ocean-fog: Coastal blue-gray with teal sea foam

polling.title: Auto-Refresh
polling.enabledDesc: Automatically update distribution status and resource usage
polling.backoffDesc: Some polls have timed out. Refresh intervals have been automatically increased to reduce load.
polling.distrosDesc: How often to check if distributions are running or stopped
polling.resourcesDesc: How often to update CPU and memory usage (only when distributions are running)
polling.healthDesc: How often to check WSL service health status
polling.tip: Tip: Polling automatically pauses when the app is minimized to save resources.

timeouts.title: WSL Timeouts
timeouts.description: Configure how long to wait for WSL commands
timeouts.infoBox: If WSL commands are timing out frequently, try increasing these values. Longer timeouts prevent errors but may delay detection of actual failures.
timeouts.quickDesc: Quick queries like listing distributions, getting version info, and status checks
timeouts.defaultDesc: Most WSL commands: start, stop, terminate, set default, mount/unmount
timeouts.longDesc: Operations that involve large file transfers or downloads
timeouts.sudoShellDesc: Commands that require elevated privileges (may prompt for password)

executables.title: Executable Paths
executables.infoBox: Override default executable paths if tools are installed in non-standard locations. Leave as default unless you have a specific reason to change them.
executables.wslDesc: WSL CLI executable for all distribution operations
executables.powershellDesc: Used for system health monitoring, disk operations, and Windows Terminal Preview
executables.windowsTerminalDesc: Windows Terminal executable for opening distributions
executables.cmdDesc: Fallback terminal when Windows Terminal is not available
executables.explorerDesc: Windows Explorer for browsing distribution files
executables.wslUncPrefixDesc: UNC path prefix for accessing WSL distribution filesystems
executables.defaultInstallLocationDesc: Base folder for new WSL distributions (import, clone, container images). Does not apply to Microsoft Store installs which use Windows-managed locations. Supports environment variables like %LOCALAPPDATA%.

wslGlobal.title: WSL Global Configuration
wslGlobal.description: Settings in .wslconfig that apply to all distributions
wslGlobal.windowsSettingsDesc: Open the native Windows Subsystem for Linux Settings app
wslGlobal.restartNote: Changes to global WSL settings require a full WSL restart (wsl --shutdown) to take effect.
wslGlobal.processorsDesc: Number of CPU cores for WSL2
wslGlobal.swapFileDesc: Custom path for the swap file
wslGlobal.localhostForwardingDesc: Forward localhost ports from WSL to Windows
wslGlobal.nestedVirtualizationDesc: Enable nested virtualization for running VMs inside WSL
wslGlobal.vmIdleTimeoutDesc: Time in milliseconds before the WSL 2 VM is shut down when idle
wslGlobal.guiApplicationsDesc: Enable support for WSLg (Linux GUI apps on Windows)
wslGlobal.debugConsoleDesc: Show the dmesg output console on startup
wslGlobal.pageReportingDesc: Allow WSL 2 to return unused memory to Windows
wslGlobal.safeModeDesc: Run WSL in safe mode (disables plugins and startup commands)
wslGlobal.autoMemoryReclaimDesc: Strategy for reclaiming memory from WSL 2
wslGlobal.preReleaseUpdatesDesc: Get early access to new WSL features when updating (may be less stable)
wslGlobal.requiresShutdown: Changes require WSL restart to take effect

wslDistro.title: Per-Distribution Configuration
wslDistro.description: Settings in wsl.conf that apply to a specific distribution
wslDistro.noteWslConf: These settings are stored in /etc/wsl.conf inside each distribution. The distribution must be running to save changes (settings are written as root).
wslDistro.noteRestart: Changes require a restart of the distribution to take effect.
wslDistro.noDistrosHint: Install a distribution to configure its settings.
wslDistro.automountEnabledDesc: Automatically mount Windows drives in WSL
wslDistro.automountRootDesc: Directory where Windows drives are mounted
wslDistro.interopEnabledDesc: Allow running Windows executables from Linux
wslDistro.appendWindowsPathDesc: Add Windows PATH directories to Linux PATH
wslDistro.defaultUserDesc: Default user when launching this distribution
wslDistro.systemdDesc: Start systemd as the init system (requires WSL 0.67.6+)
wslDistro.bootCommandDesc: Command to run on distribution boot

distributionSources.title: Distribution Sources
distributionSources.lxcEnabledDesc: Browse and install distributions from the Linux Containers image server
distributionSources.lxcBaseUrlDesc: Base URL for the Linux Containers image server
distributionSources.cacheDurationDesc: How long to cache the distribution catalog before refreshing
distributionSources.showUnstableDesc: Include development, edge, and rolling releases in the catalog
distributionSources.communityNoteSuffix: and may vary in WSL compatibility.

containerRuntime.title: Container Runtime
containerRuntime.description: Configure how container images are pulled
containerRuntime.infoBox: Choose how to pull container images. The built-in OCI implementation works for public registries. For private registries that require authentication, use Docker or Podman with your existing credentials.
containerRuntime.builtinDesc: Native implementation, no external dependencies. Works with public registries.
containerRuntime.dockerDesc: Use Docker CLI. Supports private registries with existing Docker authentication.
containerRuntime.podmanDesc: Use Podman CLI. Supports private registries with existing Podman authentication.
containerRuntime.customDesc: Specify a custom container runtime command.
containerRuntime.customCommandDesc: Command to export container image to stdout (receives image reference as argument)

privacy.title: Usage Analytics
privacy.description: Help improve WSL UI by sharing anonymous usage data
privacy.telemetryEnabledDesc: Send anonymous usage statistics to help improve the app
privacy.neverCollect: No personal data, distribution names, file paths, or identifying information is ever collected.
privacy.provider: Data is processed by <1>Aptabase</1>, a privacy-first analytics provider.
privacy.preReleaseDesc: Receive updates from the pre-release channel

about.title: WSL UI
about.description: A lightweight desktop application to manage WSL distributions.
about.builtWith: Built with Tauri, React, and Rust.

license.title: License
license.freeText: Free and open source software. You are free to use, modify, and distribute this software.
license.conversion: Derivative works must also be licensed under GPL-3.0.
